column5: Psychotic episodes can be distressing#Comma but they can be managed. If you or someone you know is experiencing such episodes#Comma consider creating a safety plan#Comma taking prescribed medications#Comma and seeking professional help. Remember that you're not alone in this journey.

column2: I HAVE A LOVED ONE WITH SCHIZOPHRENIA
column5: Supporting a loved one with schizophrenia is important. Educate yourself about the condition#Comma be patient#Comma and offer your understanding. Encourage them to continue treatment and stay connected with mental health professionals.

If you're struggling with paranoid thoughts#Comma consider talking to a mental health professional. Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT) and medication can help manage these thoughts and improve your overall well-being.
